intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris bergiana, commonly known as the common chickweed or mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its small, alternate leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, heart-shaped seed pods that resemble a shepherd’s purse, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils, gardens, and along pathways. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common weed in various regions.
